topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Viewing Hardware Profiles

body.p: A hardware profile is a named object that captures a particular host configuration. The profile can be applied to any other host with a similar hardware configuration.

ul.li: Cpu Profiles. A CPU profile is a named assignment of processors and cores.
Interface Profiles. An interface profile is a named configuration of Ethernet ports and interfaces on a host.
Storage Profiles. A storage profile is a named configuration for a list of storage resources on a computing node.
Memory Profiles A storage profile is a named configuration for a list of storage resources on a computing node.

body.note: This feature applies only to KVM region servers.
body.section:
To view hardware profles:
Launch the HP Helion OpenStack Horizon Dashboard.
Select the appropriate region and project.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Inventory tab.
Click the any of the following tables:
CPU profiles
interface profiles
storage profiles
memory profiles
